taskDescription: Reviews the health dashboard on her tablet every morning
Toggles through profiles of multiple older adults she supports
Manually records clinical details she finds relevant
Uses the voice interface to ask clients if they feel unwell
Invites clients to join gentle exercise simulations
Reflects on the differences between her empathetic style and others’ clinical approach
Check in remotely during Elena’s cognitive challenge sessions
Advocate gently for more personalized and enjoyable session settings
Encourage Elena manually to keep trying when sessions are limited
Experience frustration when disabled from adjusting session settings
Restrict access to sensitive data like location and emotional state
Feel conflicted about client’s preference for unrestricted sharing
Manually override client’s consent settings when needed
Explain privacy concerns patiently to the client via messaging
Feel cautious about too much data being shared or accessed
Manage daily schedules for multiple older adults using ALFRED
Check in with clients later after receiving alerts from ALFRED
Make calls to clients in a respectful and formal tone
Avoid overwhelming clients with too many notifications or messages
Rely on ALFRED to balance client independence and support needs
